page.title: 10STOKE CLIMSLAND CHURCH.
page.content: THE CHURCH IS MADE PRINCIPALLY OF {GRANITE.}THE ARCHITECTURAL STYLE BEING 'LATE DECORATED'. THE LAY OUT OF THE CHURCH CONSISTS OF SIX BAYS WITH A NORTH AND SOUTH AISLE.{POLYPHANT STONE HAS BEEN USED IN BOTH AISLES AND THE WORK IS THOUGHT TO DATE FROM THE{MID {THIRTEENTH CENTURY.}ALL THE{ROOFS}ARE THE{ORIGINAL FIFTEENTH CENTURY}ONES EXCEPT THE CHANCEL ROOF. THE ROOF OVER THE ALTARS WERE PAINTED BLUE, WHEN AN OFFER BY THE{DUKE OF WINDSOR,}THEN {PRINCE OF WALES}TO HAVE THE WORK DONE WAS GRATEFULLY ACCEPTED.{THE BLUE AND {GOLD CURTAINS AND FRONTAL}ON THE{ALTAR WERE PART OF THE{MATERIAL}USED IN {WESTMINSTER ABBEY}FOR THE{CORONATION {OF QUEEN ELIZABETH II,}AND WERE GIVEN TO THE CHURCH BY HER MAJESTY. THE BELLS WERE CAST BY THE PENNINGTONS OF LEZANT IN 1771 AND WERE RECAST IN 1953 BY TAYLORS OF LOUGHBOROUGH.
